title: LTER Network Documentation
text:
Version 0.1

Functioning Quarto website skeleton
GitHub Action for automated website rendering

title: Information Manager Home
text:
This part of the website is a place for new and experienced LTER information managers to refer to the latest LTER policy and practice updates.
The IM manual is intended for policies and practices that are LTER-specific, not as a replacement for broader training and best practices in information management. It is accessible by any LTER information manager, but will probably be most actively updated by the LTER Network Office and the LTER IMExec Team. All LTER Information Managers will want to “watch” the repo for updates or check back regularly. To view the source code for any of these pages, see here.
For procedures on making edits to the manual, please see CONTRIBUTING.md.

title: Documentation Website Contributing Guidelines
text:
Edits to the website built by this repository can be made either directly through GitHub or via a local clone. Currently all members of the network-office and info-managers teams have the ability to make edits and triage issues in this repository.


Please document all substantive edits in the NEWS.md file in the top level of this repository. High-level summaries of changes there will make the strategic summary of changes easier to track through time and will allow for more informative GitHub release details.



When making minor edits, feel free to make those directly in the “main” branch.



If making major edits–either to particular documents or to the structure of the website–please create a branch for those edits and submit a pull request when you are ready to have those changes be reflected in the live website.
